fields.summary: Cloudformation:  Stack fails when using NetworkInterfaceId property in AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation resource

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
*Assessment*

_Eucalyptus Version_

{{4.4.0-0.25788.147.20170202git6e5a63d.el7}}

Deploying a Cloudformation stack using linked {{cfn-ubuntu-docker-eni-vpc.json}} template fails.  The errors in the stack events are as follows:
{code}
..
EVENT	DockerExample	7ba39a84-59ac-4ed0-ac5e-c03f6e9060a3	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	DockerExample	arn:aws:cloudformation::000727120439:stack/DockerExample/f8fbda64-5f55-4ba6-a7b4-f5cd08ef8556	2017-02-09T20:55:56.400Z	CREATE_FAILED	The following resource(s) failed to create: [DockerInstance].
EVENT	DockerExample	DockerInstance-CREATE_FAILED-1486673755757	AWS::EC2::Instance	DockerInstance		2017-02-09T20:55:55.757Z	CREATE_FAILED	Channel was closed before the response was received.:RunInstancesType:b4e3d9ef-fbcb-4125-8163-63b363cf6676::10151935-fbcc-4691-8fd3-369ae7af18a9:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
...
{code}
The template works with no problems on AWS. 
{code}
$ aws cloudformation describe-stacks --profile hspencer-admin-marketing
{
    "Stacks": [
        {
            "StackId": "arn:aws:cloudformation:us-west-2:017179026131:stack/DockerExample/c59413f0-ef10-11e6-818c-50a68a0e328e",
            "Description": "Cloudformation Template to deploy Docker on Ubuntu instance",
            "Parameters": [
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "marketing-hspencer-admin",
                    "ParameterKey": "KeyName"
                },
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "ami-4e00bb2e",
                    "ParameterKey": "ImageId"
                },
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "m3.medium",
                    "ParameterKey": "InstanceType"
                }
            ],
            "Tags": [],
            "Outputs": [
                {
                    "Description": "InstanceId of the newly created EC2 instance",
                    "OutputKey": "InstanceId",
                    "OutputValue": "i-048e3286c5ca2bd77"
                },
                {
                    "Description": "Public IP address of the newly created EC2 instance",
                    "OutputKey": "PublicIP",
                    "OutputValue": "35.166.50.112"
                },
                {
                    "Description": "Availability Zone of the newly created EC2 instance",
                    "OutputKey": "AZ",
                    "OutputValue": "us-west-2b"
                }
            ],
            "CreationTime": "2017-02-09T21:43:50.495Z",
            "StackName": "DockerExample",
            "NotificationARNs": [],
            "StackStatus": "CREATE_COMPLETE",
            "DisableRollback": false
        }
    ]
}

$ ssh -i .ec2/euca-work-keypairs/marketing-hspencer-admin-west.pem ubuntu@35.166.50.112
The authenticity of host '35.166.50.112 (35.166.50.112)' can't be established.
ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:hoGFi/NVCYlTYA7zmD+Hx4xckYc50AEqoN6cx5gcY4w.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added '35.166.50.112' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts.
Welcome to Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-62-generic x86_64)

 * Documentation:  https://help.ubuntu.com
 * Management:     https://landscape.canonical.com
 * Support:        https://ubuntu.com/advantage

  Get cloud support with Ubuntu Advantage Cloud Guest:
    http://www.ubuntu.com/business/services/cloud

0 packages can be updated.
0 updates are security updates.



The programs included with the Ubuntu system are free software;
the exact distribution terms for each program are described in the
individual files in /usr/share/doc/*/copyright.

Ubuntu comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by
applicable law.

To run a command as administrator (user "root"), use "sudo <command>".
See "man sudo_root" for details.

ubuntu@ip-10-0-0-140:~$ exit
logout
Connection to 35.166.50.112 closed.
{code}

*Signs*

fields.summary: RunInstancesType error from Cloudformation SWF Activity
fields.environment: Eucalyptus VPC with multiple availability zones

comments.body: [~hspencer], do you always see this error when creating a stack from this template?

[~sjones], yes I do.  I found out the issue.  Looks like we have an error when a cloudformation template with an {{AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation}} resource has a {{NetworkInterfaceId}} property instead of an {{InstanceId}} property.  Per [AWS docs|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-eip-association.html#cfn-ec2-eipassociation-networkinterfaceid], either one can be used.  I will be raising another ticket, and redirect this one to the new one.  I will also add a minimal template that will test the exact issue.
EUCA-13230 is the cause of this behavior.
